{"step_by_step_thinking": "Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is a benign, vascular tumor that originates in the nasopharynx. The blood supply to this area is primarily from the branches of the external carotid artery. Among the options given, the internal maxillary artery, which is a branch of the external carotid artery, is the main vessel that supplies the nasopharynx.", "answer_choice": "C.
